result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

8:09 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Melissa Jo Bierman appeared by video, Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Melissa Jo Bierman. INCLUDES 21CF871 and 22CF369. Court reviews file. Atty. Erdman states there was an offer and believes it will be accepted. ADA Ballo states that the previous offer is still on the table. Atty. Erdman requests PLEAS. Court sets PLEAS. T. Sitz from JSC states that no information regarding testing has been received since 7/12. Court reminds DE that testing was suspended based on her providing information to JSC regarding testing at other facility. DE confirms address and phone number. DE to confirm with Ms. Sitz no later than 12 PM on Monday 8/29 that she is complying with bond requirements. Bond continues. Adjourned: 8:28 AM. kma
